message:
what are the best lenovo i5 laptops ??
Cost About : 4,000 EGP

data.message: the best lenovo laptops those which are belong to ThinkPad series
Check cnet.com
It depends on your needs i have lenovo ideapad z580 and hdd is not good so slow and the screen quality also nor good but there are so many other good models
نصيحة لوجه الله بلاش ! IdeaPad ، شاشته وحشه جدا و الصوت وحش و اوعك تغلط و تجيب 14 انش ..
my v580c was 60good
leeh pas :D

اشمعنا Lenovo و I5؟؟
أجمد Lenovo هو أجمد مواصفات في الـ W series، إلا لو عايز touchscreen يبقى أجمد مواصفات في الـ T series - حيث أجمد مواصفات دي حاجة حسب فلوسك و المتوفر في البلد اللي أنت فيها.
W is expensive, V is cheaper so you get more power for your oney
ما انا عايز حاجة فى دود 4000 جنيه عشان كدة بقول i5 :D
Now it make sense the question with the budget ;)
Forgot it at first :D
My z 580 coast me 4200 from a year ago
لو فيه E series في الحدود دي في مصر هيكون كويس. ماعرفش الـ V و الـ Z.
ال G5080 ايه ظروفه ؟؟ :D

Just make sure you get an SSD, this is your bottleneck 99% of the time, so no matter how fast or how many cores the processor has if you didn't invest a little bit more in an SSD you will find mediocre performance.
just make sure you get an SSD it will make lightyears of differencein performance 256 is ok in price
I agree with mohammed about the ssd point i have core i5 2.5 and the performance is like shit because of the hdd speed

I am writing this from a Dell XPS M1530 which is a Core 2 Duo about 7 years old now, I wrote it off as dead couple of years ago because of performance then I decided to give it a shot and got a 64GB SSD in it, and it was brought back from the dead, it does everything I usually do online without a hitch.
thnx alot for all :D

I have lenovo g580 ... and it's quite horrible it shows a noticeable lack on very light load ... Many IT companies prefer working with ThinkPad series, I worked for two companies that  are using ThinkPad laptops, one of these companies is Valeo .. ThinkPad laptops are the best for heavy work
Valeo ^_^

I second the ThinkPad, I used to work with a Lenovo T420s with a 256GB SSD for two years as a main development machine with a docking station to hook it to a dual monitor setup, it was working like a champ, driving three displays (Laptop + 2 x 27") handling all sorts of development tools (VS, Eclipse, ... etc simultaneously).
if you don't need 16 GB RAM upgrade your current to 500 GB SSD and 8 GB RAM
And if you want speed, use LMDE as your primary OS and have Virtual box with Windows for Visual Studio community when you need it.
